alert.note: Alert for De Witt; Logan; Macon; Piatt (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 08 at 3:23AM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of central Illinois and east central Illinois, including the following counties, in central Illinois, De Witt, Logan and Macon. In east central Illinois, Piatt. * WHEN...Until 500 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 322 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen, with the highest totals estimated by radar from north of Warrensburg to near Maroa. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Monticello, Forsyth, Maroa, Bement, Mount Pulaski, Warrensburg, Argenta, Oreana, De Land, Weldon, Latham, Kenney, Chestnut, White Heath, Ivesdale, Cisco, Rowell and Lodge.
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
